loc: Baix Llobregat (near  El Prat de Llobregat), Barcelona, Catalunya
rmk: Three herons were seen and heard flying south to north on migration in an urban setting. In the field one of the calls sounded drier and raspier. Upon closer inspection of the recording, obtained via a "nocmig" sound-trap that night, it was clear that one of the herons was in fact a Purple Heron; the bird heard calling first in the clip. The sonogram (see full) is also different, with the notes less visible, in comparison to grey.

rmk: My Olympus LS-P1 was recording next to the reedbed from 9am until 6pm. I saw the  Purple Heron Around 3pm.  I was recording at the end of the Reed bed that the bird was in and I knew it was there because it was reported by other birders.  I couldn’t  see it at the time of recording because  I was on the same side of the reservoir as the bird.
